Entries.default:
"Today's catch, I say! Fresh and hot, spiced to the tongue of outsider and local alike!"

The vendor gestures to a bed of hot coals in his wagon, a flavorsome scent rising from bundles of meat-stuffed leaves.

"You return! Ekera, I thought I heard a stomach in need." 

Wekeme waves his hand to billow the smell of cooking meat into the thoroughfare.
"I am closed for the evening, my friend - but visit again in the morning."
"For what do you return, my friend? Is your hunger so bottomless?" He chuckles and playfully slaps TekÄ“hu's shoulder.
"Wekeme, I would eat every denizen of my mother's kingdom if you cooked them up."

"This labor would be my honor if it sated Ngati's chosen." 

Wekeme bows and smiles up at you.
